newsitem.title: POLAND: Legrand buys 75 percent in Polish plant.
newsitem.headline: Legrand buys 75 percent in Polish plant.

text.p: French electric equipment producer Legrand on Saturday bought a 75 percent stake in Polish state-owned company Feal Sp. z o.o. for 88.3 million zlotys, the privatisation ministry said.

It said in a statement that Legrand pledged to invest $11 million over the next three years and then additionally $8 million in Feal, an electric equipment maker based in the southern town of Zabkowice Slaskie.
The French company will also earmark 4.2 million zlotys as extra pay for Fael's empolyees, who will also get 20 percent of the Polish firm's shares for half price, it said.
Legrand is obliged to refrain from lay-offs during the next 43 months. No further details were provided.
